reasoning: Discoid lupus erythematosus (DLE) is a cutaneous manifestation of lupus spectrum disorder. Incidence estimated at 0.3-0.5 per 100k based on dermatology cohorts and medical literature. Approximately 10-25% of lupus patients have discoid-only disease.
source: Jessop S et al. (2008). Discoid lupus erythematosus: epidemiology and mechanisms of chronic inflammation. Lupus. 17(1):3-9
